com.baypackets.ase.sbb
Interface SBBEventListener

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public interface SBBEventListener
extends java.io.Serializable

The SBBEventListener interface defines the callback mechanism for the SBBs to communicate with the application to notify the status or outcome of the action requested by the application.

Field Summary
static int CONTINUE
          A constant that requests that the SBB continue the default behavior.
static int NOOP
          A constant that requests that the SBB skip the default processing.
 
Method Summary
 void activate(SBB sbb)
          This method is invoked to notify this object that a failover has occurred and it is now running in a process space outside the one it was created in.
 int handleEvent(SBB sbb, SBBEvent event)
          The SBB invokes this method to indicate the occurance of a specific event like CONNECTED, CONNECT_FAILED or SIGNALING_IN_PROGRESS, etc.
 

Field Detail

A constant that requests that the SBB continue the default behavior.

Constant Field Values

public static final int NOOP
A constant that requests that the SBB skip the default processing.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

handleEvent

public int handleEvent(SBB sbb,
                       SBBEvent event)
The SBB invokes this method to indicate the occurance of a specific event like CONNECTED, CONNECT_FAILED or SIGNALING_IN_PROGRESS, etc.

The application returns value to tell the SBB whether or not continuing with the default processing for this event.

Parameters:
sbb - The SBB object that generated this event.
event - The event object
Returns:
CONTINUE if the SBB should continue the default processing, else NOOP.

activate

public void activate(SBB sbb)
This method is invoked to notify this object that a failover has occurred and it is now running in a process space outside the one it was created in. The application should implement this method to re-obtain any transient resources like sockets or database connections.

Parameters:
sbb - The SBB object to which this Event Listener is associated
